title: The English Major_ A Novel - Jim Harrison
description:
Jim Harrison has been called â€œa writer with immortality in himâ€ by Londonâ€™s Sunday Times and The New York Times Book Review has written that â€œ[his] storytelling instincts are nearly flawless.â€ Harrisonâ€™s last novel, Returning to Earth, was one of his most praised in years, hailed by The Plain Dealer as â€œan artistic achievement worthy of Faulkner.â€ The English Major is a wryly funny novel that sparkles with the generous humanity of his vision. 

â€œIt used to be Cliff and Vivian and now it isnâ€™t.â€ With these words, Jim Harrison begins a riotous, moving novel that sends a sixty-something man, divorced and robbed of his farm by a late-blooming real estate shark of an ex-wife, on a road trip across America, armed with a childhood puzzle of the United States and a mission to rename all the states and state birds to overcome the banal names men have given them. Cliff â€™s adventures take him through a whirlwind affair with a former student from his high schoolâ€“teacher days twenty-some years before, to a â€œsnake farmâ€ in Arizona owned by an old classmate; and to the highoctane existence of his son, a big-time movie producer who has just bought an apartment over the Presidio in San Francisco. 

The English Major is the map of a manâ€™s journey intoâ€”and out ofâ€”himself, and it is vintage Harrisonâ€”reflective, big-picture American, and replete with wicked wit
